tool.name: InternalCalibration
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if $cal.id_in: mkdir cal.id_in && ln -s '$cal.id_in' 'cal.id_in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $cal.id_in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($cal.id_in.ext)' && #end if #if $cal.lock_in: mkdir cal.lock_in && ln -s '$cal.lock_in' 'cal.lock_in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $cal.lock_in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($cal.lock_in.ext)' && #end if #if $cal.lock_out_FLAG: mkdir cal_lock_out && #end if #if $cal.lock_fail_out_FLAG: mkdir cal_lock_fail_out && #end if #if $quality_control.models_FLAG: mkdir quality_control_models && #end if #if $quality_control.models_plot_FLAG: mkdir quality_control_models_plot && #end if #if $quality_control.residuals_FLAG: mkdir quality_control_residuals && #end if #if $quality_control.residuals_plot_FLAG: mkdir quality_control_residuals_plot && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && export PYTHONPATH='$__tool_directory__/CTDopts/' && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #if $cal.id_in: -cal:id_in 'cal.id_in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $cal.id_in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($cal.id_in.ext)' #end if #if $cal.lock_in: -cal:lock_in 'cal.lock_in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $cal.lock_in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($cal.lock_in.ext)' #end if #if $cal.lock_out_FLAG: -cal:lock_out 'cal_lock_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if $cal.lock_fail_out_FLAG: -cal:lock_fail_out 'cal_lock_fail_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if $quality_control.models_FLAG: -quality_control:models 'quality_control_models/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' #end if #if $quality_control.models_plot_FLAG: -quality_control:models_plot 'quality_control_models_plot/output.${gxy2omsext("png")}' #end if #if $quality_control.residuals_FLAG: -quality_control:residuals 'quality_control_residuals/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' #end if #if $quality_control.residuals_plot_FLAG: -quality_control:residuals_plot 'quality_control_residuals_plot/output.${gxy2omsext("png")}' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #if $cal.lock_out_FLAG: && mv 'cal_lock_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$cal.lock_out' #end if #if $cal.lock_fail_out_FLAG: && mv 'cal_lock_fail_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$cal.lock_fail_out' #end if #if $quality_control.models_FLAG: && mv 'quality_control_models/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' '$quality_control.models' #end if #if $quality_control.models_plot_FLAG: && mv 'quality_control_models_plot/output.${gxy2omsext("png")}' '$quality_control.models_plot' #end if #if $quality_control.residuals_FLAG: && mv 'quality_control_residuals/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' '$quality_control.residuals' #end if #if $quality_control.residuals_plot_FLAG: && mv 'quality_control_residuals_plot/output.${gxy2omsext("png")}' '$quality_control.residuals_plot' #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced' and $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input peak file

param.name: ppm_match_tolerance
param.label: Finding calibrants in raw data uses this tolerance (for lock masses and ID's)

param.name: ms_level
param.label: Target MS levels to apply the transformation onto
param.help: Does not affect calibrant collection (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: RT_chunking
param.label: RT window (one-sided
param.help: i.e. left->center, or center->right) around an MS scan in which calibrants are collected to build a model. Set to -1 to use ALL calibrants for all scans, i.e. a global model

section.name: cal
section.title: Chose one of two optional input files ('id_in' or 'lock_in') to define the calibration masses/function

param.name: id_in
param.label: Identifications or features whose peptide ID's serve as calibration masses

param.name: lock_in
param.label: Input file containing reference m/z values (text file with each line as: m/z ms-level charge) which occur in all scans

param.name: lock_out_FLAG
param.label: Generate output lock_out (Optional output file containing peaks from 'in' which were matched to reference m/z values)
param.help: Useful to see which peaks were used for calibration

param.name: lock_fail_out_FLAG
param.label: Generate output lock_fail_out (Optional output file containing lock masses which were NOT found or accepted(!) in data from 'in')
param.help: Useful to see which peaks were used for calibration

param.name: lock_require_mono
param.label: Require all lock masses to be monoisotopic
param.help: i.e. not the iso1, iso2 etc ('charge' column is used to determine the spacing). Peaks which are not mono-isotopic are not used

param.name: lock_require_iso
param.label: Require all lock masses to have at least the +1 isotope
param.help: Peaks without isotope pattern are not used

param.name: model_type
param.label: Type of function to be fitted to the calibration points

param.name: enabled
param.label: Apply RANSAC to calibration points to remove outliers before fitting a model

param.name: threshold
param.label: Threshold for accepting inliers (instrument precision (not accuracy!) as ppm^2 distance)

param.name: pc_inliers
param.label: Minimum percentage (of available data) of inliers (<threshold away from model) to accept the model

param.name: iter
param.label: Maximal # iterations

param.name: median
param.label: The median ppm error of calibrated masses must be smaller than this threshold

param.name: MAD
param.label: The median absolute deviation of the ppm error of calibrated masses must be smaller than this threshold

section.name: quality_control
section.title: Tables and plots to verify calibration performance

param.name: models_FLAG
param.label: Generate output models (Table of model parameters for each spectrum)

param.name: models_plot_FLAG
param.label: Generate output models_plot (Plot image of model parameters for each spectrum)

param.name: residuals_FLAG
param.label: Generate output residuals (Table of pre- and post calibration errors)

param.name: residuals_plot_FLAG
param.label: Generate output residuals_plot (Plot image of pre- and post calibration errors)

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: ctd_out_FLAG
param.label: Output used ctd (ini) configuration file

tool.help:
Applies an internal mass recalibration.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_InternalCalibration.html
